title: Prefigurative Community Building (Part 16): Stewardship Commons - Rewilding Land through Collective Care
summary: Create Stewardship Commons where land is held, restored, and cared for collectively without ownership. Practice rewilding as participatory process that interweaves ecological and social healing.

Community.summary: Build collective land stewardship that heals both ecology and social relationships.

resources.label: Regenerative Land Trusts via Agrarian Trust

level0: Identify degraded or underutilized land for potential stewardship
Assemble circle of care with diverse community connections
level1: Learn from the land and its history through observation and research
level2: Develop light-touch rewilding plan that lets land lead
Structure participation through shared roles and seasonal workdays
level3: Formalize collective land care through appropriate legal structures
Build networks of connected stewardship commons

Knowledge.summary: Share ecological and traditional knowledge while learning collective land care practices.

resources.label: Braiding Sweetgrass by Robin Wall Kimmerer

level0: Learn what grows naturally and what has been lost or extracted
Study Indigenous land relationships and responsibilities
level1: Practice ecological observation and adaptive land tending
Share knowledge horizontally between all participants
level2: Develop expertise in native species restoration and permaculture
Validate lived experience and ancestral wisdom equally
level3: Become bioregional resource for collective land stewardship
Teach others about Power With approaches to land care

Narrative.summary: Transform relationship with land from ownership and extraction to reciprocity and care.

resources.label: Common Cause Handbook on Shared Values

level0: Practice seeing land as relationship rather than property
Learn principles of reciprocity with more-than-human world
level1: Share stories about collective land stewardship and restoration
Challenge narratives of human separation from nature
level2: Help others understand land as commons rather than commodity
level3: Transform community understanding toward ecological interdependence
Build culture where land stewardship is collective responsibility
